result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonya M. Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full from bond posted

With Huber for all purposes
May serve in Oneida or Forest County
To commence on/before

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sonya M. Daniels

defendant.name: Daniels, Sonya M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:28 p.m. Defendant Sonya M. Daniels in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct/A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. Michlig/Siehr/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 5 days with Huber to commence on/before February 25, 2016 may serve in Oneida or Forest County
CC/DNA surcharge
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Costs to be taken from bond posted/balance refunded to poster.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 2:37 P.,M.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

11:37 a.m. Attorney Gabriel G. Siehr in court via telephone with leave of Court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sonya M. Daniels not in court.   In receipt of complaint. Defendant called attorney this morning and stated she was ill. Attorney states defendant told them on Monday that she intended to hire them - attorney received paperwork today via fax for representation. Court authorizes body only warrant - Siehr's objection to warrant based on earlier representations is noted. 
Bail continued. Adj. 11:42 a.m.

Defendant Sonya M. Daniels in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:58
Court questions defendant to tardiness- defendant statement - Court statement to defendant - has counsel -(Sier) Schiek statement - Court will not require additional bond at this time -  
Court directs defendant to sign bond - Defense counsel may appear telephonically at next date -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Notified Judy at ONSO - voluntary appearance made

2:01 p.m. Defendant Sonya M. Daniels in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant re non-appearance - Defendant states she has been in court in Shawano County - the last 5 Mondays - didn't come16th because her son was sick and then had an all night funeral for her aunt - no disrespect to court but things happen -   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Michlig/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
1:34 p.m. Defendant Sonya M. Daniels not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court does not rescind authorization of previously authorized warrant. Adj. 1:34 p.m.
No appearance by Defendant - State appears by Steven Michlig - Michlig states defendant was advised of 10-12-15 court date - Court authorizes warrant.
